job_description: A Co-op at Ericsson:At Ericsson our co-ops are a tightly knit group of about 20 students each term working on various projects. Our co-ops benefit from social gatherings planned amongst themselves and through the office. They frequently go out for lunch as a group and also get to work in a dynamic environment of managers and other permanent Ericsson employees. Our co-ops work on exciting projects that revolve around the Networked Society. Other benefits of the Burnaby office include free gym membership, free pastries every Friday and flexible working hours.A co-op at Ericsson is a great step in the door as well to future full time opportunities after graduation!Ericsson OverviewEricsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment and services to mobile and fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, and more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business and society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people and society to help shape a more sustainable world.We are truly a global company, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment where employees enhance their potential every day. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience and continuous learning and growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to reach your career goals.Ericsson is present in 4 major Canadian cities: Montreal, Ottawa, Toronto and Vancouver.70% of the mobile traffic in Canada goes through Ericsson systems. We strive to deliver the highest quality products and services to our customers.Co-op Position OverviewEricsson offers a supportive and friendly working environment. Our Co-op students are included in important projects and they get to contribute in the development of network infrastructures that supports connected devices for millions of users around the globe.Co-op Job DescriptionWe are currently recruiting for a Software Testing Co−op to join our IP OS Regression Test Team, located in Burnaby. This position is for an 8 month term.As a Software Test Engineer Co-op, you will be involved in verification and validation for the Ericsson IP Operating System that is used for SSR router and other platforms. You may become responsible for collecting and tracking test results, developing automation scripts and testing router features. You will also have the opportunity to build automation tools and set up routers and test equipment.
job_requirements: Ideal Co-op Profile:• Entering 3rd of 4th year of university in Computer Sciences, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Engineering Science. • Has completed a previous co-op work termThe following skills will be a definite asset:• Basic understanding of computer networks: TCP/IP, Routing protocols.• Basic knowledge of router CLI command.• Exposure to Perl, TCL/TK, or Python.• Familiar with Linux environment and Shell scripting.• Familiar with MS Excel.• Enthusiasm on learning and contributing in diversified teams.• Strong written and verbal communication skill.• Strong problem solving skills, willing to take on challenges.• Understand software development methodologies and development cycles.• Strong programming skills.Relevant academic projects relating to these technical skills will be considered.If you do not have these skills coming into your co−op term with Ericsson – you will definitely have them when you leave!What can you learn at Ericsson?Here is what some of former co−ops are saying:What I learned from Ericsson? − Perl, Networking protocols, scripting language, routing and switching information, debug, verify and update test scripts. I also learned how the testing cycle runs and working productively in a time constrained environment.What I enjoy about Ericsson? − Excellent work space and nice building, Weekly Friday pastries, flexible working hours, friendly co−workers, 50 cent vending machine.Working at Ericsson has given me an idea of the daily operations and activities of a software company. Just by being in this environment made me learn more than I could in a classroom. I felt immediately welcome on my team, and was treated like a significant member. I enjoyed working on a project with deadlines and learning from those around me. I would highly recommend a term with a company that is so driven!http://www.ericsson.com/thinkingahead/networked_society*please note all roles at Ericsson’s Vancouver site are subject to compliance with US Export laws. We thank all of those interested in Ericsson, however only selected applicants will be contacted for an interview.Open To All Majors:No
